question.title: Why is this part of my for loop not working?
question.body:
I have this for loop in my code which uses an array filled with randomly generated numbers which is as follow

for (int i = 0; EndResult == true; i++) {   
    count = count + 1;
    
    if (count == 1) {//adds size of arraylist to arraycount
        ArrayCount.add(CardReduce.size());
    }
    
    for (int a = 0; a < CardReduce.size(); a++) {//replaces values by same value - 1
        int val = CardReduce.get(a);
        CardReduce.set(a, (val -1));
    }
    
    for (int b = 0; b < CardReduce.size(); b++) {//removes all elements with value of 0
        CardReduce.remove(Integer.valueOf(0));
    } 
    
    if (count == CardReduce.size()) {//when count is equal to size of CardReduce executes 
        CardReduce.addAll(ArrayCount);
        Collections.sort(CardReduce);
        System.out.println(CardReduce);
        ArrayCount.clear();
        count = 0;
    }
    
    if (count == 8) {
        EndResult = false;
    }
}

my issue is the if loop where count is equal to CardReduce size as all other code except this part works. As this part of the code is supposed to execute once the count is equal to the arraylist size but for some reason it doesn't. As what this for loop is supposed to do is store the size of the original array in a seperate arraylist. And for each cycle loop throught the elements of the randomly generated array subtract one from that number and increase count each time its done remove any zeros if present. Once the count is equal to the size of CardReduce array add the size of the stored array sort that array and clear the stored size so a new one can be added next cycle.

For example lets say the random numbers I got in the array was 2 2 7 9 25 at the end of the first cycle it should now be 1 1 6 8 24 5 but instead I get 4 5 6 22 as the only value of the result that is correct is the 5 as thats the number of elements in the original array but the rest are completely wrong. From testing I pretty sure that the code thats causing the problem is the if loop where count is equal to CardReduce size.

Edit: So this is the code in its entirety but simplified to its necessary parts

import java.util.*;

public class test {
    
    public static void main(String[] args) {
    
        int[] EndResult = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9};
        int[] RandomCards = new int[45];
        int Size = 0;
        int total = 45;
        int count = 0;
    
        for(int i = 0; total > 0; i++) {
            int random = (int) (Math.random() * total) + 1;
            total -= random;
            RandomCards[i] = random;
            Size++;
            Arrays.sort(RandomCards);
            }
        
        System.out.println("Cards Seperated in Stacks: ");
        for (int i = 0; i < RandomCards.length; i++) {
            
            if (RandomCards[i] > 0) {
                System.out.print(RandomCards[i] + " ");
            }
        }
        
        System.out.println(" ");
        System.out.println("==========================");
        System.out.println("Game Start: ");
        
        ArrayList<Integer> CardReduce = new ArrayList<Integer>();
        ArrayList<Integer> ArrayCount = new ArrayList<Integer>();
        Boolean FinalResult = true;
        count = 0;
        
        for(int i = 0; i < RandomCards.length; i++) {
            
            if (RandomCards[i] > 0) {
                CardReduce.add(RandomCards[i]);
            }
        }
        
        for (int i = 0; FinalResult == true; i++) {   
            count = count + 1;
            
            if (count == 1) {//adds size of arraylist to arraycount
                ArrayCount.add(CardReduce.size());
            }
            
            for (int a = 0; a < CardReduce.size(); a++) {//replaces values by same value - 1
                int val = CardReduce.get(a);
                CardReduce.set(a, (val -1));
            }
            
            for (int b = 0; b < CardReduce.size(); b++) {//removes all elements with value of 0
                CardReduce.remove(Integer.valueOf(0));
            } 
            
            if (count == CardReduce.size()) {//when count is equal to size of CardReduce executes 
                CardReduce.addAll(ArrayCount);
                Collections.sort(CardReduce);
                System.out.println(CardReduce);
                ArrayCount.clear();
                count = 0;
            }
            
            if (count == 8) {
                FinalResult = false;
            }
        }
    }
}
